column2: list of all applications to install as a base for our system.
TAG (A for AUR - G for git and make - P for pip - C for clone only - empty for pacman)
column3: NAME IN REPO (or git url)
column4: PURPOSE (should be a verb phrase to sound right while installing) Leave empty line at end.

column3: is a cross-platform, GPU-accelerated terminal emulator.
is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URLs.
is a modern replacement for the venerable file-listing command-line program ls.
is a monitor of system resources, bpytop ported to C++.
is a fast and versatile file copying tool for remote and local files.
is a cat clone with syntax highlighting and git integration.
is like Neofetch, but much faster because written in C.
is for extracting and viewing files in .zip archives.
is a smarter cd command for your terminal.
is a directory listing program displaying a depth indented list of files.
is a command-line fuzzy finder.
is good-looking diffs with diff-highlight and more.
manages your dotfiles interactively with fzf.
are command line tools that assist applications with a variety of desktop integration tasks.
is a front-end to ssh-agent, allowing one long-running ssh-agent process per system, rather than per login.
is a collection of useful unix tools.
is a command-line JSON processor.
are contributed scripts and tools for pacman systems.
supports programs for Network File Systems.
renames multiple files using Perl regular expressions.
is the RAR uncompression program.
